Because they still haven't been noticed i will try to contact you this way. These are some extreme bugs: http://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/suggestions-bug-reports-en/vY5ubIxc-bug-all-regions-tahm-bug-urgent

Rumble's Flamespitter ostensibly has the same issue.

And I'd wager that Kayle's and Cho's E AoE effects should also be treated as damage-over-time effects, due to their repetitive applicability without any cost...
Kayle actually has a cost, but damage-over-time effects are explicitly narrowed to effects which apply damage after the initial hit has landed, i.e. Cassio's poisons or Brand's passive.

> [{quoted}](name=ProfDrDeath,realm=EUW,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=AW1mvxVJ,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2015-07-14T12:39:45.610+0000)
>
> Rumble's Flamespitter ostensibly has the same issue.
> 
> And I'd wager that Kayle's and Cho's E AoE effects should also be treated as damage-over-time effects, due to their repetitive applicability without any cost...

In my eyes, the definition of a damage over time effect is that it need only be applied once to deal damage multiple times. Rumble's flamespitter applies multiple times, true, but moving out of range of the area of effect will immediately stop damage (barring liandry's). As somebody who doesn't play Rumble, I understand the point and would understand if an exception were made for this ability and the slow were trimmed to 20%, but I believe that this would be an exception rather than following the rule.

Further, Cho'Gath's E would also be an exception.

In the case of Singed, not only is the poison an AoE effect, but stepping into the poison applies a 3 second DoT which just so happens to be continuously reapplied so long as one stands in the effect. It should, by definition, cause a 20% slow instead of the 40% slow it is currently applying.
